data.title: Customization
authors: Contributors to A Hat in Time Wiki
data.meta_description: Customization is a large game mechanic in A Hat in Time, which allows the player to change parts of the game's aesthetic through Flairs, Dyes, Costumes, and Music. During Hat Kid's adventure, she can unlock customizations by exchanging Rift Tokens in the Orb Machine hidden behind the barrels in...
data.text:
Customization is a large game mechanic in A Hat in Time, which allows the player to change parts of the game's aesthetic through Flairs, Dyes, Costumes, and Music.

During Hat Kid's adventure, she can unlock customizations by exchanging Rift Tokens in the Orb Machine hidden behind the barrels in the Main room of Hat Kid's Spaceship, or by completing each Time Rift for the first time. Customization options include Hat Flairs to change the appearance of certain Hats, palettes that change the colors for Hat Kid's clothing/hair, and remixes to change the music in certain levels/areas.

As of the Nyakuza Metro DLC, the number of Customizations acquirable trough The Roulette is a total of 35. Listed:

Hat Flairs (48) Base Hat Found in Roulette Not Found in Roulette ☆ ☆☆ ☆☆☆ Seal the Deal (DLC) Nyakuza Metro (DLC) Vanessa's Curse (DLC) Special / Events

Color Palettes (34) and Costumes (18) From Roulette

(base game) Rarity: ☆ ☆☆ ☆☆☆ Challenge Rewards

(Seal the Deal DLC) Nyakuza Shops

(Nyakuza Metro DLC) Crowns and Souls Rewards (Vanessa's Curse DLC) Live Game Events

Remixes (7) Welcome to Mafia Town (2) Battle of the Birds (2) Mafia Town:

Electronic Remix

Mafia Boss:

Orchestral Remix The Moon:

Jazz Remix

Train Rush:

Electro Swing Remix Subcon Forest (2) Time Rifts (1) Subcon Village:

Sci-Fi Remix

Your Contract Has Expired:

Orchestral Remix Water Time Rift:

Orchestral Remix Vanessa's Curse (DLC) (1) Vanessa's Curse (DLC) Round:

A Deadly Tag Remix

Hat Flairs[]

Normal Hat Flairs[]

Not all hats change with Hat Kid's palette. The ones that do will be mentioned below.

Image Hat Rarity Color change Description Kid's Hat ☆ Yes Gives Hat Kid's favorite hat a bow. Kid's Hat ☆☆ Yes Gives Hat Kid's favorite hat a bow and vertical stripes. Kid's Hat ☆☆☆ Yes Gives Hat Kid's favorite hat a bow, a rose and vertical stripes. Sprint Hat ☆ Yes Replaces the Sprint Hat to a ladybug headband. The red of the band changes to the color of Hat Kid's color palette if equipped. Sprint Hat ☆☆ Yes Replaces the Sprint Hat with a dinosaur hoodie. Sprint Hat ☆☆☆ No Replaces the Sprint Hat with a News Boy's Cap. The cap also includes several technological enhancements, like a microphone and enhancing eyepieces on the goggles, though these are purely cosmetic. Brewing Hat ☆ No Gives the Brewing Hat pink and white stripes, making it look like the hat of Vivian in Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door. Ice Hat ☆ Yes Changes the Ice Hat into a festive Santa hat. Ice Hat ☆☆ Yes Changes the Ice Hat into a night cap with cat's ears on the top. The base hat alongside the rim and the end of the cap change color alongside any palette changes equipped, defaulting to purple and yellow. This could possibly foreshadow the Nyakuza Metro DLC due to the cat ears on top and its color scheme. Ice Hat ☆☆☆ No Changes the Ice Hat into a yak hat with a pony tail. Dweller's Mask ☆ No Alternates from the Fox mask to the pink kitsune Dweller Mask. Badges adhere to the top of the forehead and ends of the ears. Dweller's Mask ☆☆ No Alternates from the Fox mask to the green bull Dweller Mask. Badges adhere to the top of the forehead and ends of the antlers. Dweller's Mask ☆☆☆ No Alternates from the Fox mask to the white tattooed Dweller Mask. Badges adhere to the top of the forehead and ends of the antlers. Kid's Hat - Yes Also known as the "Completionist Kid's Hat." Changes Kid's Hat to have a tartan pattern and the ribbon to have polka dots.

Given to the player after obtaining all Time Pieces.

[]

The modding update added some new flairs to a few of the hats. While originally an update for just the PC version of the game, these flairs can be found on both PC and console versions of the game

Image Hat Rarity Color change Description Sprint Hat ☆☆☆ No A mask resembling a chicken. It does not cover Hat Kid's hair, but the red comb of the chicken is on top of her head. Ice Hat ☆☆☆ No Changes the Ice Hat to a nautilus shell with blue tentacles on the side. Most likely a reference to Lord Helix, a meme from Twitch Plays Pokemon. Time Stop Hat ☆ No Changes the Time Stop Hat to a hat resembling a panda fused with a squid. Time Stop Hat ☆☆☆ No Changes the Time Stop Hat to a tin foil hat with crazy-eyed goggles. It'd be perfect for stopping aliens if you weren't one yourself.

Death Wish Flairs[]

These are the Hat Flairs that can be found be clearing challenges in Death Wish Mode.

Image Hat Reward From Color change Description Sprint Hat Rift Collapse: Mafia of Cooks Yes Changes Sprint Hat to a bow, which is placed on the back side of Hat Kid's head. Brewing Hat Encore! Encore! No Changes Brewing Hat to a chef’s hat. Ice Hat The Mustache Gauntlet No Changes Ice Hat to a knight's helmet. Sprint Hat Cruizin' for a Bruzin' No Changes Sprint Hat to a Captain's Hat.

Nyakuza Hat Flairs[]

These hats are added with the Nyakuza Metro DLC and can be bought from the Gang Sellers around the area.

Image Hat Price Color change Description Kid's Hat 150 No Bought from a cat in Yellow Overpass Station

Changes Kid's Hat to a flower crown.

Sprint Hat 150 Yes Changes Sprint Hat to an indigo cap. Brewing Hat 150 No Bought from one of the three alley cats near the jewel store.

Changes Brewing Hat to a headband with cat ears, and a mask with a cat's nose and mouth on it. This flair also changes the explosions of the potions into dollar explosions

Brewing Hat 150 No Bought from a cat near the manhole in Green Clean Station.

Changes Brewing Hat to a burger-themed cap.

Dweller's Mask 150 Yes Bought from a cat in Yellow Overpass Station

Changes Dweller's Mask to a yellow beret, with glasses.

Time Stop Hat 150 Yes Bought from a cat near the bluefin ticket seller in Bluefin Tunnel

Changes Time Stop Hat to a helmet with an ear piece, inside a translucent orb.

Time Stop Hat 150 Yes Bought from a cat above the pink paw ticket seller in Pink Paw Station

Changes Time Stop Hat to a pair of headphones.

Vanessa's Curse Hat Flairs[]

These hats are added with Vanessa's Curse (DLC) and can be bought from Snatcher and the Badge Seller in the lobby. With Snatcher, only a certain amount of crowns needs to be met without having to actually spending it on Snatcher.

Image Hat Price Color change Description Sprint Hat 1 Crown Yes "What's the harm in keeping one for yourself?"

Bought from the Snatcher in the lobby.

Changes Sprint Hat to a golden crown.

Ice Hat 10 Crowns Yes "Transform into a box when you feel like it!"

Bought from the Snatcher in the lobby.

Changes Ice Hat to a witch hat with fox ears. Turns the player into a ice block with the hat still visible above when used.

This flair and its description are a reference to the Box Fox costume from Balan Wonderworld.

Brewing Hat 20 Crowns Yes "Easy to make. Just dump sprinkles into a blender!"

Bought from the Snatcher in the lobby.

Changes Brewing Hat into a wearable donut. Instead of a potion, you throw a donut which when explode, release sprinkle like explosion effects.

Dweller's Mask 30 Crowns Yes "Peer into the spectral world with this stellar visor!"

Bought from the Snatcher in the lobby.

Changes Dweller's Mask to a futuristic visor.

Ice Hat 40 Crowns Yes "It covers your head, but icy through it just fine."

Bought from the Snatcher in the lobby.

Changes Ice Hat to a wearable ice block. This ice block stays on the player's head when used.

Sprint Hat 60 Crowns Yes "Hop into the fray with this bunny beret!"

Bought from the Snatcher in the lobby.

Changes Sprint Hat to a bunny beret.

Brewing Hat 70 Crowns Yes "Enlighten your enemies!"

Bought from the Snatcher in the lobby.

Changes Brewing Hat to a yellow lampshade. When you throw the potion, it unleashed a lightning-like explosion.

Sprint Hat 10 Souls Yes "Hide your eyes with this feathery disguise!"

Bought from the Badge Seller in the lobby.

Changes Sprint Hat to a grey eye mask with dark yellow feathers.

Sprint Hat 10 Souls Yes "Baddest girl in town!"

Bought from Badge Seller in the lobby.

Changes Sprint Hat to a punk cap. Has the same style and description of the punk outfit and Gothic Umbrella also available at the Badge Seller.

Event Hat Flairs[]

These hats were given out at specific events such as being a backer, being in a Speedrun event, or completing a challenge in a Live Game Event.

Image Hat Rarity Color change Event Description Kid's Hat - Yes Speedrun event[1] Gives Hat Kid's favorite hat a bow, and a digital timer. Kid's Hat - Yes Backer exclusive[2] Gives Hat Kid's favorite hat a bow, and a green rose. Brewing Hat - Yes Complete the Rain Aquarium Hotel Rehydrated challenge in Death Wish Mode during the Summer Event. Also available on Steam Workshop instantly. Known as the "Sun Hat". Gives Hat Kid a large sun hat with a sunflower on it along with sunglasses. Sprint Hat - Yes Complete the Snatcher's NOT Sketchy Carnival challenge in Death Wish Mode during the Summer Event. Also available on Steam Workshop instantly. "To protect your eyes from the... moon?"

Known as the "Moonglasses". Gives Hat Kid a pair of sunglasses with Moon Jumper-shaped lenses.

Brewing Hat - Yes Complete the Breezy Summer Parasailing challenge in Death Wish Mode during the Summer Event. Also available on Steam Workshop instantly. Known as the "Watermelon Sun Hat". Gives Hat Kid a watermelon-themed sun hat with vines coming off of it. Sprint Hat - Yes Complete the Cave Story Weapons challenge in Death Wish Mode during the Summer Event. Also available on Steam Workshop instantly. "We need the juice!" -

Known as the "Timepiece Juice Hat". Gives Hat Kid the same hat featured in the Discord-exclusive HeckDrinkHat sticker.

Color Palettes[]

Normal Dyes[]

Name Image Appearance Rarity Description Blueberry Pie - Changes Hat Kid's shirt and hat dark blue, her cape and ribbon yellow, her pants off white, her boots tan, and dyes her hair blonde. This dye may be inspired by the DC Superhero Booster Gold from the DC Comics Universe. Forest Critter - Change's Hat Kid's shirt and hat forest green, her cape and ribbon strong yellow green, her pants white, her boots brown, her clasp orange and dyes her hair blonde.

This makes her look like Link from The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker.

Minty Fresh - Turns Hat Kid's shirt and hat olive green, her cape and ribbon moss green, her clasp honey yellow and dyes her hair ash blonde. Margin of Night ☆ Changes Hat Kid's shirt scarlet, her hat and pants wine red, her cape purple, her boots brown, her clasp rose, her ribbon crimson and dyes her hair lapis.

These colors are the same as Niko from the indie game OneShot. This is made obvious by the fact that Nightmargin is the online name of the main artist, character designer, musician, and co-writer of OneShot.

The Freedom ☆ Changes Hat Kid's shirt and hat white, her cape red, her pants and boots blue, her cape red, and her ribbon lilac while dying her hair the same color.

This color is based off of Lilac from the game series Freedom Planet.

Captain of the Sea ☆☆ Changes Hat Kid's shirt and ribbon navy, her hat, cape and shoes white, her pants space blue and her clasp and zipper yellow. The color scheme might be based on the Seal The Deal DLC, as well as being a reference to Weiss Schnee from RWBY (probably due to the white coloring of her clothes.) Cookie Dough ☆☆ Changes Hat Kid's shirt, hat and boots lemon, her cape and ribbon pink, and her pants and clasp purple. The Blood Moon ☆☆

Changes Hat Kid's shirt and hat dark red, her cape, ribbon and pants black, and her claps, zipper, boots and hair white.

The red and black color pallette and white hair are likely a reference to the character Ragna from the Blazblue series and Dante from the Devil May Cry series.

Cute ‘n Dangerous ☆☆☆

Turns Hat Kid's shirt, hat and boots pink, her cape and ribbon fucsia, her clasp blue, her zipper gold and dyes her hair blonde.

This is the same color palette as Princess Peach from the Mario series.

The Big Appetite ☆☆☆ Changes Hat Kid's shirt and hat purple, her cape and ribbon yellow, her pants violet, her boots green, her clasp a light pink and dyes her hair black.

This palette is the same as Wario, one of the antagonists of the Mario series. It also looks similar to Hat Kid's regular clothing.

The Widow ☆☆☆ Turns Hat Kid's shirt and hat crow black, her cape, ribbon and pants ink black, her clasp turquoise, her zipper tawny brown and dyes her hair black. This may be a reference to Blake Belladonna from RWBY.

DLC Dyes[]

These color palettes are added with DLC. While only Cardboard is added with Seal the Deal (DLC), the rest are added with Nyakuza Metro (DLC) and Vanessa's Curse (DLC). None of these dyes are found in the Roulette, and instead are bought from NPCs or rewards for completing certain challenges.

Name Image Appearance Description Cardboard Reward for clearing Snatcher Coins in Mafia Town.

This palette is Seal the Deal exclusive.

Gives a cardboard texture to Hat Kid's clothing.

Green Bean Bought from a cat near the Empress's Jewelry Store for 25 pons.

Makes Hat Kid's shirt and top hat band a dark blue, and her hat and cape a light green.

Dignified Bought from a cat near the Empress's Jewelry Store for 75 pons.

Gives Hat Kid a dark red diamond pattern on her shirt, and a gray cape.

Obnoxious Bought from a cat near the Empress's Jewelry Store for 75 pons.

Gives a square pattern to her cape, having extremely saturated shades of sky blue and yellow, her shirt a saturated blue, pants a bright pink, and shoes yellow.

Mixed Berries Bought from a cat in Main Station for 25 pons.

Changes Hat Kid's shirt to blue, her cape to red, and her pants white.

Citrus Bought from a cat in Main Station next to the yellow ticket gate for 75 pons.

Gives Hat Kid a lemon-lime color scheme.

Fortress Bought from a cat in Yellow Overpass Station next to the blue ticket gate for 25 pons.

This Dye, alongside the Battlements dye, is based off of Team Fortress 2, and its own paint system for its various cosmetics. The reds and oranges are likely in reference to that game's RED team.

Battlements Bought from a cat in Yellow Overpass Station next to the blue ticket gate for 75 pons.

This Dye, alongside the Fortress dye, is based off of Team Fortress 2, and its own paint system for its various cosmetics. The blues and yellows are likely in reference to that game's BLU team.

The Justice Bought from a cat in Yellow Overpass Station next to the blue ticket gate for 75 pons.

This dye gives hat kid that same palette as Mustache Girl, sporting a waistband unique to this dye.

Cherry Soda Bought from a cat in Yellow Overpass Station right after one of the yellow ticket gates for 25 pons.

Changes Hat Kid's shirt a bright red, her cape white, and pants black.

Busy Bee Bought from a cat in Yellow Overpass Station right after one of the yellow ticket gates for 25 pons.

Gives Hat Kid the color scheme of a bumblebee, and possibly the main color scheme of Yang Xiao Long from RWBY.

Coffee with Cream Bought from a cat in Yellow Overpass Station right after one of the yellow ticket gates for 75 pons.

Changes Hat Kid's shirt to a brown to white gradient, her cape white, and pants a dark brown.

Pizza Time Bought from a cat in Yellow Overpass Station right after one of the yellow ticket gates for 75 pons.

The name references an iconic line from the 2004 movie Spider-Man 2.

Bleeding Edge Bought from a cat near the bluefin ticket seller in Bluefin Tunnel for 25 pons

This skin could be a reference to several things, such as:

Shadow the Hedgehog from the Sonic the Hedgehog series

Akame and Kurome from the anime Akame Ga Kill!

Ruby Rose from the animated webseries RWBY

Lucia from Punishing Gray Raven

It could also be the possible inspiration for several characters from the 2021 game Scarlet Nexus, developed and published by Bandai Namco Entertainment.

Milky Way Bought from a cat near the bluefin ticket seller in Bluefin Tunnel for 75 pons.

Gives Hat Kid's shirt and shoes a light blue color, her cape magenta, along with a star pattern, her pants white, and blonde hair.

Ribbit Bought from a cat near the pink ticket seller for 25 pons.

Gives Hat Kid a frog-like color scheme.

Some think this could represent Yoshi from the Yoshi’s Island and Mario series or Tamagon in Devil World.

Anarchy Bought from a cat near the pink ticket seller for 75 pons.

Makes Hat Kid's cape indigo, her hair and pants a light blue, and her shirt have a black and purple striped pattern.

Hamburger Bought from a cat near the Green Clean Manhole for 25 pons.

Gives Hat Kid a color palette resembling a hamburger, with her lower body colored like a patty, her torso colored like a burger bun, and her cape colored like lettuce.

Too Hot to Handle Bought from a cat near the Green Clean Manhole for 75 pons.

Makes Hat Kid's hair orange, and puts a fire pattern on her cape and shirt.

Blue Comet "Look out for the stars!"

Bought from the Snatcher for 3 Crowns.

Makes Hat Kid's hair dark purple, her shirt and pants dark blue, her cape light blue, and her shoes regular blue.

Rolling Heart "A lovely pink dye with a dash of gold!"

Bought from the Snatcher for 15 Crowns.

Makes Hat Kid's hair blonde, her shirt white, her cape and shoes light red, and her pants purple.

Burning Violet "Soft violet with a fiery slash of rogue."

Bought from the Snatcher for 35 Crowns.

Makes Hat Kid's hair, shirt, pants, and shoes different shades of violet and her cape white.

City Girl "A palette of soft pastel colours."

Bought from the Snatcher for 65 Crowns.

Makes Hat Kid's hair light pink, her shirt and shoes regular pink, her cape white, and her pants magenta.

Costumes[]

The Seal the Deal DLC also adds costumes for Hat Kid to wear. To unlock these costumes, however, she must complete several of the Snatcher's challenges. Nyakuza Metro also adds some more costumes that can be bought from the cats found around the metro.

Name Image Appearance Obtained by Description The Queen's Dress Costume Complete the candle challenge Snatcher Coins in Subcon Forest This is the outfit Queen Vanessa wears in the Storybook Pages. Hiking Shorts Costume Complete the candle challenge Snatcher Coins in Alpine Skyline This outfit is the same outfit that Banjo wears in Banjo Kazooie. Transcendent Costume Complete the Death Wish challenge The Illness Has Speedrun Changes Hat Kid a space-like texture, and makes her eyes closed. Metallic Costume Complete the Death Wish challenge Rift Collapse:Dead Bird Studio This costume makes Hat Kid look like Metal Mario from Super Mario 64. Parade Costume Complete the Death Wish challenge Killing Two Birds This is the outfit Hat Kid wears during The Big Parade. Witch Costume Complete the Death Wish challenge Breaching the Contract Gives Hat Kid a black dress with a purple belt, and an engraving of The Snatcher's face on the shirt's purple collar. 24 Karat Kid Costume Complete the Death Wish challenge No More Bad Guys Makes Hat Kid look shiny and golden in a metallic way. Shadow Puppet Complete the Death Wish challenge Seal the Deal This costume makes Hat Kid look similar to The Snatcher himself. Nyakuza Varsity Jacket Bought from one of the three alley cats near the jewel store for 225 pons "Only cool cats can wear this outfit. This is the largest size they offer."

A purple hoodie with yellow sleeves, cat-shaped pockets, a gold zipper, and a cat tail hanging from the back.

Comfy Sweater Bought from a cat in Yellow Overpass Station next to the blue ticket gate for 200 pons "It's like a pillow that you can climb inside."

A purple sweater, with an image of a hot mug on it.

Wireframe Bought from a cat in Yellow Overpass Station right after a yellow ticket gate for 200 pons "It looks unfinished, but that's in style these days!"

This outfit also augments Hat Kid's hats to show up as a wireframe too, superseding any flairs equipped to show the base hat's wireframe.

Old Film Bought from the Snatcher for 50 Crowns in Vanessa's Curse "A grainy retro-styled look."

Covers Hat Kid in a grainy, white texture.

Golden Crown Bought from the Snatcher for 100 Crowns in Vanessa's Curse "A very, VERY expensive aesthetic!"

Covers Hat Kid in a shiny, golden texture, like Vanessa's Crowns.

Punk Set Bought from the Badge Seller for 5 Souls in Vanessa's Curse "Baddest girl in town!"

A punk shirt. Has the same style and description of the hat and Gothic Umbrella also available at the Badge Seller.

Summer Fairy Complete the Pirate Palm Paradise community map challenge in Death Wish Mode only during the Summer Event "Spread a bit of rainbow joy!"

Covers Hat Kid in a shiny, color-changing texture between light blue and light pink. Also surrounds her with fluttering, colorful butterflies and gives her transparent butterfly wings on her back. Also makes Hat Kid close her eyes.

Remixes[]

Changes the music played in certain levels and areas. They can be adjusted by the Wowl Band, whom are found on the Spaceship once the player has collected their first remix.

Image Track Obtained by Mafia Town (Electronic Remix) Playing the Roulette on Hat Kid's Spaceship. Mafia Boss (Orchestral Remix) Playing the Roulette on Hat Kid's Spaceship. The Moon (Jazz Remix) Playing the Roulette on Hat Kid's Spaceship. Subcon Village (Sci-Fi Remix) Playing the Roulette on Hat Kid's Spaceship. Water Time Rift (Orchestral Remix) Playing the Roulette on Hat Kid's Spaceship.

Train Rush (Electronic Remix)

Playing the Roulette on Hat Kid's Spaceship.

Your Contract Has Expired (Orchestral Remix)

Playing the Roulette on Hat Kid's Spaceship.

A Deadly Tag (Remix)

Bought from the Badge Seller for 5 Souls.

Trivia[]

The Time Stop Hat has no Flairs on the game's console version, but has some on the PC and Switch versions.

The Brewing Hat is the only hat to have only one Flair outside of any DLC.

A contest was held on Kickstarter to decide on a design for the Backer exclusive hat. The winning design ended up being unused, but a model for it still remains in the game's files.

When Hat Kid transforms into an ice statue via the Ice Hat's ability, the Ice Hat will remain in its normal appearance, regardless if any hat flair for the Ice Hat is equipped (with the exception of the 2 Ice Hats obtainable from Vanessa's Curse (DLC)).

Despite adding in many new Dyes, Flairs and Costumes, the Nyakuza Metro DLC has all of its customization options purchased exclusively through its many Gang Sellers, with none being featured in the Roulette.

The original release on the Xbox and Playstation versions had a glitch which stopped the Completionist's Hat from spawning. As of the Nyakuza Metro (DLC), that glitch has been fixed.

The Completionist Kid's Hat is the only hat flair to have a special ability: When worn, previously collected Green Pons will be coloured white on one half, as opposed to the regular green.
